description: Contracts must describe how customer data is collected, stored, and deleted, referencing applicable privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA).
Documents must define authentication and authorization mechanisms for any system integrations or shared environments.
Incident response timelines and notification duties must be stated for security events affecting either party.
Vendors must maintain business continuity or disaster recovery plans with testing expectations.
Use of subcontractors/subprocessors requires written approval and flow-down of all security obligations.
Contracts must require encryption of data in transit and at rest using contemporary standards.
Customer must retain audit/assessment rights at least annually, including document review or on-site visits.
Termination clauses must cover data return/destruction and continued confidentiality obligations.
Text should cite adherence to relevant industry standards (HIPAA, SOC 2, ISO 27001, PCI DSS) when applicable.
Vendors must provide evidence of periodic security and privacy training for personnel handling sensitive data.
System maintenance clauses must include patching timelines or vulnerability remediation expectations.
Any data sharing with affiliates or partners must require equivalent safeguards and notification to the customer.
Agreements must clearly state IP ownership, licensing rights, and restrictions on derivative use of shared materials.
Clauses handling payment data must reference PCI DSS compliance or equivalent protections.
Standard confidentiality clauses must outline definition of confidential information, exclusions, and duration of duty.
